item.title: Hosting my Hugo blog on Github Pages
item.description:
After initially hosting my blog on a virtual machine instance on Google Cloud, I had other things to do and took my time getting around to finding an alternate hosting solution. Since I still don’t have a lot of time, I decided to try Github Pages - it sounded pretty simple, and in fact it is.

I followed a tutorial on the Hugo site, but didn’t go quite as far with configuring the git repository - I’m just running Hugo and committing changes to make updates. At some point I may want to make this automated, we’ll see.

For the meantime Github Pages seems like a good way to go - it’s free, and easy to use.
